As someone said - averages are always prone to outliers. Median the most accurate metric. And I can vouch for the authenticity of the people maintaining the sheet - you can even talk to them on discord if you want to.

That's cause you're looking at tier 1 median. I don't think the file has statistical metrics that combine all tiers. I'll ask them to add it in.

take the CTC with a pinch of salt, it is not a representation of annual income, as some(a lot) of companies have stocks vested over some years but the entire SOP is counted in the ctc that they send out to college. use base pay instead.

Other tier 2 colleges like rv manipal have 13-15 median

Just few points to add on

1) Median of package is an accurate representation of what to expect, not average

2) The CTC as quoted by companies during placements is not an indication of how good/bad the college is. Companies just see the market conditions, their budget and the tier ranking of the college

3) To get an above median salary (irrespective of college) focus on yourself, upskill for the role you want, network with seniors/other peeps in similar industry and keep getting relevant experience before the placement season starts.

Good Luck <3
